page.title: 13CONIFEROUS WOODLAND ON ARNE
page.content: Coniferous woodland was planted by the landowners with Scots Pine and Maritime Pine for commercial use.Such a habitat has a very poor species diversity when compared to deciduous woodland because of the dense shade engendered by the close planting which restricts or even eliminates completely the ground flora.Also the thick covering of pine needles restricts plant growth.Jays and Wood Pigeons nest in the trees with several species of Tits and the Gold-crested Wren seen in the open borders;small herds of Sika and Roe deer;Grey Squirrels and the ant hills of the large black wood ants, which are the most obvious invertebrate inhabitants of the forest floor, can also be seen.
